name: Second Harvest Food Bank
mission: Summer Meals Second Harvest works with school districts and community partners to maximize the use of federally funded school meals.
theoryOfChange: Nutritious food is the foundation for a healthy, productive life; Second Harvest distributes nutritious food across Silicon Valley through programs and a partner network, and also supports enrollment in CalFresh and provides nutrition education and advocacy to strengthen food assistance and address root causes of hunger.
zakatClaimEvidence: Second Harvest of Silicon Valley's website and donation pages, including their 'Ways to Give' [2], 'Donation FAQs' [3], and 'Donate Funds' [10] sections, do not explicitly mention 'zakat' as a donation option or a dedicated fund. There is no statement indicating they accept or are compliant with zakat donations. (Source: https://www.shfb.org/give-help/donate-money/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or clearly state whether donations are zakat-eligible.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 31/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, extreme poverty cause area

score_details.score_summary: Second Harvest of Silicon Valley shows exceptional impact and good alignment.

zakat.claim_evidence: Second Harvest of Silicon Valley's website and donation pages, including their 'Ways to Give' [2], 'Donation FAQs' [3], and 'Donate Funds' [10] sections, do not explicitly mention 'zakat' as a donation option or a dedicated fund. There is no statement indicating they accept or are compliant with zakat donations. (Source: https://www.shfb.org/give-help/donate-money/)

all_citations.claim: The charity has a 100.0/100 score, a 94.8% program expense ratio, 9.5 months of working capital, and a fundraising efficiency of $0.03 per $1 raised.
The organization reported total revenue of $286,205,684.
The organization serves an average monthly client base through its mission to maximize school meals and community resources.
The charity provides grants and assistance to domestic organizations and individuals to combat food insecurity.
The organization accepts general donations and voluntary charitable giving (sadaqah).

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a strong score due to its perfect financial transparency and high program efficiency, though the overall score is moderated by its specific regional focus and medium donor fit for those seeking traditional faith-based alignment.
areas_for_improvement: High cost per beneficiary relative to some international relief programs
Moderate alignment with specific religious donor preferences

dimension_explanations.alignment: While the cause urgency is high due to extreme poverty in the region, the donor fit is considered medium for those seeking specific religious frameworks, as the organization is classified as sadaqah-eligible [5]. It maintains a long track record of service, utilizing community partners and food connections to reach vulnerable populations [3][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high impact through direct provision, spending $286,205,684 in total revenue to combat extreme poverty and food insecurity [1][2]. With a program expense ratio of 94.8%, the charity efficiently converts donations into community services, including grocery programs and summer meals for students [1][4].

baseline_narrative.headline: Second Harvest of Silicon Valley is a top-rated food bank dedicated to eliminating hunger through direct grocery provision and strategic community partnerships.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 94.8%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach the community [1]
High fundraising efficiency with costs limited to $0.03 per $1 raised [1]
Strong liquidity with 9.5 months of working capital available to sustain operations [1]
baseline_narrative.summary: Second Harvest of Silicon Valley provides essential food assistance to residents in Santa Clara and San Mateo counties, operating with a mission to maximize federally funded school meals and community resources [1][3]. The organization maintains a perfect Charity Navigator score of 100.0/100, reflecting its commitment to financial health and transparency [1].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a strong score due to its perfect financial transparency and high program efficiency, though the overall score is moderated by its specific regional focus and medium donor fit for those seeking traditional faith-based alignment.

areas_for_improvement.context: The calculated <cite id="15">cost of $528.78 per beneficiary</cite> is higher than many international relief models, though it reflects the high cost of living and logistics in Silicon Valley.
The organization has seen a <cite id="16">3-year revenue CAGR of -5.8%</cite>, indicating a slight decline from pandemic-era funding peaks.

bbb_assessment.summary: Meets all 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards for Charity Accountability

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains nearly 9.5 months of working capital to mitigate revenue fluctuations.
risk_factors: <cite id="16">Negative 5.8% revenue growth</cite> over the last three years
<cite id="15">Higher cost-to-serve</cite> compared to global hunger charities
case_against.summary: The primary limitation is the geographic focus and the <cite id="16">recent downward trend in annual revenue</cite>.

confidence.data_freshness: Financial data current through 2023 tax year
data_gaps: Volunteer and employee counts not explicitly detailed in recent summaries
confidence.notes: Extremely high data availability and consistent third-party verification.

known_gaps: Specific volunteer and employee counts not provided in summary data

alignment.explanation: The charity is a strong fit for those prioritizing <cite id="18">extreme poverty alleviation</cite> and humanitarian service, though it lacks specific religious designations.
alignment.improvement: The charity could improve alignment for Muslim donors by <cite id="19">adding a dedicated page clarifying the eligibility of its programs</cite> for specific types of charitable giving.

credibility.explanation: Donors can have absolute confidence in this charity due to its <cite id="8">100.0/100 from Charity Navigator rating</cite> and its <cite id="14">compliance with all 20 BBB accountability standards</cite>.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by a <cite id="4">94.8% program expense ratio</cite> and a <cite id="17">strong theory of change</cite> that transitions from crisis response to sustainable community empowerment.
impact.improvement: To improve impact scores, the charity could work to reduce the <cite id="15">$528.78 cost per beneficiary</cite> through further logistical optimizations.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade A - Verified outcomes and external evaluations

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Distributes food and financial assistance to local partners and individuals to maximize regional food access.

rich_narrative.headline: Second Harvest of Silicon Valley is a top-rated food bank dedicated to eliminating hunger through direct grocery provision and strategic community partnerships.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support high-efficiency, large-scale food security in Northern California through a highly transparent and stable institution.
donor_motivations: Value perfect transparency and 100/100 third-party ratings
Want to ensure over 94 cents of every dollar goes to food programs
Care about local poverty and hunger in the Silicon Valley region
Prefer supporting established organizations with decades of history
giving_considerations: Donations support local US residents rather than international crisis zones
The organization is a mainstream non-profit, not a religious institution
High operational costs reflect the expensive local service environment
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill Zakat obligations or those looking for international relief in the Global South.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade A reflects verified outcome tracking, <cite id="21">external evaluation documents</cite>, and a perfect impact score from Charity Navigator.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The organization focuses on transitioning from crisis response to sustainable community impact by maximizing federal meal programs and deepening community partnerships.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that food distribution actually reduces long-term food insecurity rather than just providing temporary relief.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While highly efficient, the charity has seen a slight decline in revenue, suggesting a need for new donor bases to maintain its massive scale.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: Santa Clara and San Mateo Counties

peer_comparison.differentiator: Second Harvest's <cite id="4">94.6% program ratio</cite> exceeds the <cite id="20">peer median of 89.6%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focuses on immediate disaster response globally
similar_organizations.name: World Central Kitchen

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focuses on housing rather than food security
similar_organizations.name: Habitat for Humanity International

strengths.detail: The organization holds a <cite id="8">perfect overall score of 100.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting top marks across impact, accountability, and leadership beacons.
Second Harvest operates with a <cite id="9">fundraising efficiency of $0.03 per $1 raised</cite>, which is significantly better than industry averages.
The charity maintains <cite id="10">9.5 months of working capital</cite>, providing a resilient buffer to sustain food distribution during economic downturns.

strengths_deep_dive: Second Harvest's operational excellence is validated by its <cite id="11">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, the highest level of recognition for non-profit data sharing. Their governance is supported by an <cite id="12">independent board comprising 94% of its 17 members</cite>, ensuring objective oversight of their <cite id="13">$242 million in total assets</cite>. Furthermore, the organization meets <cite id="14">all 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards</cite> for Charity Accountability, confirming their adherence to best practices in governance and financial reporting.
rich_narrative.summary: Second Harvest of Silicon Valley is a premier hunger-relief organization that has served the Santa Clara and San Mateo counties since its <cite id="1">founding in 1974</cite>. The organization operates at a massive scale, reporting <cite id="2">$286,205,684 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. Its mission centers on eliminating hunger through a multi-pronged approach that includes <cite id="3">direct grocery programs, CalFresh outreach, and advocacy</cite>. A hallmark of its operations is its extreme financial efficiency; the charity maintains a <cite id="4">program expense ratio of 94.8%</cite>, ensuring that the vast majority of resources are converted into community aid. During peak periods of need, the organization has demonstrated the capacity to support an <cite id="5">average of 500,000 clients monthly</cite>. Beyond direct distribution, Second Harvest acts as a regional hub, providing <cite id="6">$126,143,515 in grants and assistance to domestic organizations</cite> to strengthen the local food security infrastructure. This dual role as a direct provider and a strategic grantmaker allows them to maximize the use of <cite id="7">federally funded school and summer meals</cite> across Northern California.
